content.text: Department: Department of Information Technology
Address: Room 1310 (Building A1) - NEU, 207 Giai Phong - Hai Ba Trưng district- HN.
Lecturer:

This module introduces the operations of computer systems at the level of instruction set architecture (ISA). It provides a basic understanding of the design principles of modern computers and their components. The course focuses specifically on pipeline techniques, memory tiered design. Implementation issues are also emphasized. Performance measurement and analysis methods are also discussed to evaluate different architectures.

The course also aims to train thinking ability, calculation skills and improve the ability to apply knowledge to analyze and research problems in the field of computer architecture. The course equips learners with the necessary knowledge, skills and competencies to search, retrieve and exploit subject-related resources and continue to higher education.

sections.title: 9.1. Regulations on conditions for the end-of-course exam
sections.label: regulations-on-conditions-for-the-end-of-course-exam
path_titles: 9.1. Regulations on conditions for the end-of-course exam

content.text: Students are allowed to take the final exam/terminal exam (50%) if their attendance score (10%) reaches 5 points or more (scale of 10).
section_path: 9.1. Regulations on conditions for the end-of-course exam

content.text: Students/students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure, there must be sufficient and reasonable proofs. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted from the process assessment. Students who miss more than 3 classes, with or without reason, will be considered as not completing the course and must re-register.
Students will be added points for each construction speech, which can be compensated for attendance points and test scores.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and teachers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to school on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class.
Absolutely do not make noise, affecting others during the learning process.
Absolutely do not eat, chew gum, use devices such as phones, music players during class time.
Notebooks and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking lecture notes, calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely not for other purposes.

full_text:
COURSE SYLLABUS
(Promulgated together with the decision No. QD/ĐHKTTQD, 2021)
Department: Department of Information Technology
Address: Room 1310 (Building A1) - NEU, 207 Giai Phong - Hai Ba Trưng district- HN.
Lecturer:
This module introduces the operations of computer systems at the level of instruction set architecture (ISA). It provides a basic understanding of the design principles of modern computers and their components. The course focuses specifically on pipeline techniques, memory tiered design. Implementation issues are also emphasized. Performance measurement and analysis methods are also discussed to evaluate different architectures.
The course also aims to train thinking ability, calculation skills and improve the ability to apply knowledge to analyze and research problems in the field of computer architecture. The course equips learners with the necessary knowledge, skills and competencies to search, retrieve and exploit subject-related resources and continue to higher education.
Course books:
[1] John L. Hennessy (2012) Computer Architecture - A quantitative Approach, Mk Publisher.
Reference books:
[2] Patterson, D. A., and J. L. Hennessy. Computer Organization and Design: The Hardware/Software Interface, 3rd ed. San Mateo, CA: Morgan Kaufman, 2004. ISBN: 1558606041.
Table 5.1. Course Objectives
Table 6.1. Course Learning Outcomes
Table 7.1. Course assessment
Table 8.1. Lesson plan
Students are allowed to take the final exam/terminal exam (50%) if their attendance score (10%) reaches 5 points or more (scale of 10).
Students/students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure, there must be sufficient and reasonable proofs. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted from the process assessment. Students who miss more than 3 classes, with or without reason, will be considered as not completing the course and must re-register.
Students will be added points for each construction speech, which can be compensated for attendance points and test scores.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and teachers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to school on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class.
Absolutely do not make noise, affecting others during the learning process.
Absolutely do not eat, chew gum, use devices such as phones, music players during class time.
Notebooks and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking lecture notes, calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely not for other purposes.
